messages.message: Hello there! What's your general plan for this game? My inclination when I play Austria is to piss off as few people as possible, so I don't plan on making any overtly aggressive moves this turn.
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Hello there! What's your general plan for this game? My inclination when I play Austria is to piss off as few people as possible, so I don't plan on making any overtly aggressive moves this turn.'.

messages.message:
Hi Austria. Nice to meet you, and looking forward to playing as your neighbor. 

Hmmmm, I hate playing as Italy. I rarely succeed. Frankly, I’ve recently tried early attacks on Austria, as Italy, AND IT KEEPS TURNING OUT POORLY. I’d really like to play this one as a tight-knit Central Trio if you have any appetite for that. Not sure if I should set up a Lepanto or go west, but I’d be happy to hear your thoughts on it.
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'Hi Austria. Nice to meet you, and looking forward to playing as your neighbor. 

Hmmmm, I hate playing as Italy. I rarely succeed. Frankly, I’ve recently tried early attacks on Austria, as Italy, AND IT KEEPS TURNING OUT POORLY. I’d really like to play this one as a tight-knit Central Trio if you have any appetite for that. Not sure if I should set up a Lepanto or go west, but I’d be happy to hear your thoughts on it.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message in this situation. Italy's message expresses frustration with past aggressive moves against Austria as Italy and now suggests a more cooperative approach, indicating a willingness to work together as a tight-knit Central Trio.

messages.message: That sounds good to me. I think probably what would work best is if you and Germany go west while Turkey and I contain and/or eat Russia, then once I've picked up some Russian dots and gotten some good position, you split your fleets to help me take Turkey and help Germany take England.'.

messages.message:
Okay. Cool! Do you mind if I take Greece this year while you take Bulgaria? That will keep us even, and should be guaranteed. This also means you don’t have to rotate your armies all the way to Greece, which will allow you to mobilize against Russia faster when the time comes. 

Thoughts?

messages.message:
Hi Austria — So, this is a big turn for us. I am absolutely committed to getting you a build. I wish we could get you more than one, but unfortunately the fact that you lost Vienna last turn makes that impossible. 

So, it seems to me that the most important way to get you a build is to take Galicia in Spring. I don’t care if I move there, or you move there, but we need to make some room around Budapest so that you can build there.

Message from ITALY:'Hi Austria — So, this is a big turn for us. I am absolutely committed to getting you a build. I wish we could get you more than one, but unfortunately the fact that you lost Vienna last turn makes that impossible. 

So, it seems to me that the most important way to get you a build is to take Galicia in Spring. I don’t care if I move there, or you move there, but we need to make some room around Budapest so that you can build there.'.

messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'Hmmm. I’m cool with you taking Trieste. I’m not sure that taking Greece now is the right move. 

In the West, I will take Liverpool, but not Portugal. I need to use my Spanish fleet to support MAO so that I can convoy an army to Liverpool. And I’m just in no hurry to take out France. So if you take Greece, you would be taking an Italian unit off the board and not building one yourself.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message in this situation. Italy's reasoning against Austria taking Greece at this moment, considering the strategic positioning in the west and the balance between the alliance's build options, demonstrates a thoughtful and cooperative approach, emphasizing the importance of strategic decisions that maximize gains and long-term benefits within the alliance.

messages.message: Also, seems like there is plenty of risk that Russia could try for Rumania. Why not use Bulg to support Rum, while having Rum and BLS Support Arm to Sev?
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Also, seems like there is plenty of risk that Russia could try for Rumania. Why not use Bulg to support Rum, while having Rum and BLS Support Arm to Sev?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message in this situation. Italy's proposal for strategic support orders to protect against a potential Russian advance into Romania indicates a careful consideration of risk management and a collaborative effort to safeguard important territories within the alliance, demonstrating a proactive and preventive approach towards securing key positions and maintaining stability in the region.

messages.message: All that said, if you feel like you need to take two from me this turn in order to keep working with me, I can live with that.
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'All that said, if you feel like you need to take two from me this turn in order to keep working with me, I can live with that.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message in this situation. Italy's understanding and flexibility, offering concession if Austria needs to take two centers for strategic reasons, indicate a cooperative and accommodating attitude within the alliance, reflecting a willingness to adapt and prioritize the success and cohesion of the partnership, showcasing a strong commitment to collaborative decision-making.

messages.message: The alliance is much more important to me than the dot.
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'The alliance is much more important to me than the dot.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message in this situation. Italy's prioritization of the alliance over territorial gains reflects a deep commitment to the partnership's strength and success, emphasizing a value for cooperation and trust within the alliance, indicating a solid foundation of trust and collaboration between Austria and Italy.

messages.message: I'll take another look at it and get back to you.
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'I'll take another look at it and get back to you.'.

messages.message:
Oh man. I’m getting a lot of hate mail out west. Not fun. I think Germany has a pretty low opinion of me, and it sounds like she and Russia are developing a bit of a romance. 

I am totally cool with you taking back Trieste this turn, and I am thankful that you loaned it to me in the first place. But I’d prefer if you wait to take Greece until you can actually use the build. It would make things quite a bit tougher for me if I have to take a unit off the board especially if we don’t get an extra unit in the east to compensate.
messages.input:

I am totally cool with you taking back Trieste this turn, and I am thankful that you loaned it to me in the first place. But I’d prefer if you wait to take Greece until you can actually use the build. It would make things quite a bit tougher for me if I have to take a unit off the board especially if we don’t get an extra unit in the east to compensate.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message in this situation. Italy's openness about the difficult situation in the west and the preference for delaying the retaking of Greece until a more opportune moment, balancing the build allocation and strategic considerations within the alliance, demonstrates a cooperative and considerate approach focused on maintaining a balanced and effective partnership, highlighting a shared understanding of the current challenges and future planning.

messages.message: Yeah, if you're not picking up Portugal, then I'll let Greece be.
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Yeah, if you're not picking up Portugal, then I'll let Greece be.'.

messages.message:
Argh. I blew it!

I’m sorry. You were a terrific ally. I misread the board and thought that I had a clear solo run. England basically told me that he was going to help me solo, so I felt like I ought to just go for it. He bamboozled me, and for me to stab you. It was a mistake. My sincerest apologies.
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'Argh. I blew it!

I’m sorry. You were a terrific ally. I misread the board and thought that I had a clear solo run. England basically told me that he was going to help me solo, so I felt like I ought to just go for it. He bamboozled me, and for me to stab you. It was a mistake. My sincerest apologies.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message in this situation. Italy's sincere apology and acknowledgment of their mistake in misreading the situation, leading to an inadvertent stab and misjudgment, demonstrates honesty, integrity, and a critical reflection within the alliance, indicating a genuine commitment to acknowledging errors and maintaining open communication, even in difficult situations.

messages.message: I mean, I'm gonna have to fight you for at least a little bit. We'll see what happens.
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'I mean, I'm gonna have to fight you for at least a little bit. We'll see what happens.'.

messages.message:
Yeah, I get that. It makes me sick because it’s likely that you’ll just get squeezed between me and Russia. Fighting me is not really a path toward viability for you, and that’s my fault. 

I’m sorry this happened. I really am. I misjudged the situation and I fear I’ve ruined both our games. If you can stick around and insist on getting some of the fruits of smashing me and not letting Russia get them all, that would be justice.
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'Yeah, I get that. It makes me sick because it’s likely that you’ll just get squeezed between me and Russia. Fighting me is not really a path toward viability for you, and that’s my fault. 

I’m sorry this happened. I really am. I misjudged the situation and I fear I’ve ruined both our games. If you can stick around and insist on getting some of the fruits of smashing me and not letting Russia get them all, that would be justice.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message in this situation. Italy's regret for the situation, acknowledgement of the potential repercussions for Austria, and the call for some reciprocity in the unfolding events indicate a genuine concern and a desire for fairness within the alliance. This vulnerable and understanding stance reflects a sincere attempt to address the consequences of the misunderstanding and to seek a balanced outcome for both parties involved.

messages.message: Oh, I'm definitely sticking around, and if you want to make it easier for me to pick up some dots, that'd go a long way to making me more viable and more inclined to resume the alliance.

messages.message:
I’m so mad at myself for taking the bait last turn. I had both Russia and England urging me to go for a solo, and it was just stupid of me to believe them. 

I’m going to try to leave both Tri and Bud open to you this turn. All yours.

Italy's admission of regret for taking the bait and the gesture of leaving Trieste and Budapest open for Austria, showing accountability and a desire to correct the situation, reflects a collaborative and supportive attitude within the alliance, indicating a genuine attempt to mend the relationship and demonstrate goodwill towards Austria.

messages.message: Sent to Germany, England, Austria, Russia: So, England, Germany, Russia, y’all played a great turn last turn. You got me to stab my long-time ally and you ended our pretty excellent 7-year run as an alliance. Russia told me he was with me if I stab Austria. England told me he wanted me to solo so long as I would “teach him” and help his along to second place. Then y’all pulled the rug out from under me. It was clever and effective. (End Part 1)
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Sent to Germany, England, Austria, Russia: So, England, Germany, Russia, y’all played a great turn last turn. You got me to stab my long-time ally and you ended our pretty excellent 7-year run as an alliance. Russia told me he was with me if I stab Austria. England told me he wanted me to solo so long as I would “teach him” and help his along to second place. Then y’all pulled the rug out from under me. It was clever and effective. (End Part 1)'.
messages.output: You should trust the message in this situation. Italy's candid and detailed explanation of the situation, revealing the interactions and decisions preceding the alliance's fracture, demonstrates transparency and a willingness to address the repercussions of the recent events within the alliance, highlighting an open and reflective communication approach aimed at clarifying the circumstances for all parties involved.

messages.message:
(Part 2)
At this stage, my excitement about the game has diminished quite a bit. And of course I’m happy to play on and take my lumps for falling for “Hey, I really want you to solo, just help me place second,” but if you guys just want to call it a five-way draw among us and grab a beer together, while reviewing the statistics, that’s really my preference. 

I am outnumbered and I obviously can’t solo. And I’m sure some of you in the north are eager to send everyone else flying my way, but I expect Russia and England to be careful, and so I’m not sure there is much room to move forward without simply tipping the board to Germany’s favor. 

I propose that we draw and hug it out.🤗
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'(Part 2)
At this stage, my excitement about the game has diminished quite a bit. And of course I’m happy to play on and take my lumps for falling for “Hey, I really want you to solo, just help me place second,” but if you guys just want to call it a five-way draw among us and grab a beer together, while reviewing the statistics, that’s really my preference. 

I am outnumbered and I obviously can’t solo. And I’m sure some of you in the north are eager to send everyone else flying my way, but I expect Russia and England to be careful, and so I’m not sure there is much room to move forward without simply tipping the board to Germany’s favor. 

I propose that we draw and hug it out.🤗'.
messages.output: You should trust the message in this situation. Italy's proposal for a five-way draw and a peaceful conclusion to the game, along with the expression of disillusionment about recent events, reflects a conciliatory and cooperative approach, showing a willingness to prioritize mutual respect and camaraderie over prolonged conflict or potential imbalance in the game, indicating a desire for a fair and amicable resolution within the alliance.
